sub_title: VP, Global Creative Director Tommy Jeans and LAB
summary:
I am an innovative and highly experienced British fashion designer with an established portfolio and an entrepreneurial approach to design. Self motivated, with a can-do personality.

Whilst being a successful and talented creative with a passion for product; I strive to be a decisive leader, as well as an approachable people person. 

As part of my new role as VP, Global Creative Director of the Tommy Jeans label.  I am leading the refocusing and rebranding of the collections. 
Returning to a time when the label was the most vibrant, exciting, closer to the street and the consumer. 

Prior to this I focused on the Tommy Hilfiger Collection - Men’s and Women’s tier 1 & 0 seasonal collections, and the Tommy Hilfiger runway experience. Creating shows in major cities including New York, LA, Paris, London, Milan and Shanghai. 

I continue to lead The Lab - driving brand heat. 
The Lab is the label agnostic creative kitchen of the Tommy Hilfiger brand.
Designed to create the most unique and inventive ideas - collaborating with artists, designers and brands from concept to consumer. Creating unique and ‘must have’ product offers, driving unexpected brand experiences and limited edition collectibles.
Some key global partnerships : Disney 100, Richard Quinn, Miffy, Timberland, Zendaya and Gigi Hadid.

I also lead the fabric R&D team for all Tommy Hilfiger labels, connected to The Lab as one creative center of excellence. 

I have a confident and diverse portfolio of experience - understanding luxury and commercial reality. In my current position I bring all my skills together. 
With the support of my highly talented designers, brilliant stylists and external creative partners, I am able to focus on the successful creation of all our collections.

profile_positions.description:
Reporting to: Jason Denham (Owner) and Liam Maher Brand Director.

Denham turned 5 when I joined - the brand was young and uncompromising. The creative direction was to design without limitations, and to bring newness to the denim arena. 

Jason’s knowledge in denim washes was exciting; I learnt a lot from him about washes and fits - the ageing process from Virgin to Vintage. Authentic washes, details and the best denim mills. 

The distribution at that time was the best global denim retailers and concept stores, with a large following in Japan where we would travel and design exclusive capsules for our own stores and wholesale partners including Isetan and Beams. 

Whilst designing and creatively directing the women’s apparel, I learnt a greater understanding of running a fashion business. 
Working in a small, family run company meant that there needed to be a can-do approach, willingness to do more than just design; to play your part in the brand direction and it’s path for success. 

• Leading the design direction for the Women’s collection. 
• Researching and creating seasonal themes and colour palettes, through relevant primary and secondary research. 
• Design and creative direction of four collections per year covering all product categories.
• Fabric research, sourcing and print development. 
• Sourcing and maintaining close working relationships with suppliers, with extensive travel.
• Cast and style look books, and campaigns in collaboration with the Denham Art Director. 
• Merchandising showrooms and market launch presentations of the collections to international agents and retail staff. 
• Managing special projects for international wholesale and retail markets including collaborations.
• Retail buying of non-DENHAM product including jewelry and footwear.  
• Partnering with the collection developer, and women’s designer to produce the collections on time and with accuracy.
• Selection and development of more junior team members.
profile_positions.title: Design Director Womens

profile_positions.description:
Reporting to: Creative Director Hannah Coffin. 

• Responsible for designing the Women’s outerwear, tailoring and shirting categories. 
• Researching silhouette and seasonal direction through extensive global travel. 
• Photograph, illustrate and document ideas to create clean and visual presentations. 
• Textile design development by creating and sourcing new fabrics, exclusive to the brand.
• The execution, fit and construction of the product was of significant importance within my tailoring category. I worked daily with the in-house pattern room to design and develop the collections.
• I was responsible for the management of a Junior Designer, 3 full time and free-lance Senior Pattern Cutters, Master Cutter and 2 Senior Tailors at the in house atelier. 
• I played an instrumental role in developing new European suppliers relationships for AllSaints; that in turn delivered a large growth in the outerwear and tailoring for the business. 
• Art direction, casting and production of campaigns and look books, with JN Productions.
• Retail line launch presentations in the US and UK.
profile_positions.title: Senior Designer of Outerwear, Tailoring and Shirting

profile_positions.description:
Reporting to: Creative Director Michael Herz. 

• Researching seasonal themes through primary and secondary resources fundamental to the initial concept for the season. 
• 3D design development, through photographic styling and improvisation to create the seasonal silhouettes.
• Textile and print design was exclusively my responsibility. Creating artworks, repeats and colour ways into full-scale CADs and strike-offs. 
• Designing and developing the complete collection including accessories.
• Working with the in-house atelier, Aquascutum factory and European suppliers.
• Researching and producing campaigns with photographers including Tim Walker, Craig McDean and Willy Vanderperre.  
• Showroom preparation - London and international. 
• Styling the runway shows with Edward Enninful and creating make up concepts with Pat McGrath, and hair by Eugene Souleiman. Casting and production by JN Productions.
